column5: Just got back form Mink Lake with Northern Wilderness, fantastic time lots of walleyes and a 24lb northern Only problem was when we crossed at Fort Francis the DNR was there and asked if we had bait. I explained we had Dead Salted Minnows. He stated that it was a criminal offence to bring in more then 10 dozen dead minnows per person period. They just started enforcing this year. We lost 30 dozen minnows, and received a stern warning. Everybody should be pre-warned
Here's a link to a long thread about it:https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...minnows&page=3
What was their procedure for determining how many minnows you were over? Did you tell them how many you had, have them packaged by the dozen, did they count or estimate, etc.
They counted them, 2 dozen per package. They searched at least 6 other vehicles while we were there. All stated that they had bait with them.
